intro: Sibthorpia evolvulacea, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Sibthorpia evolvulacea is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions.
